intro: Saussurea falconeri, commonly known as the Karakoram saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and the Karakoram. It is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to the extreme conditions of its mountainous habitat. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs to reduce water loss. Saussurea falconeri plays a significant role in the ecological balance of its alpine ecosystem.
